description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, only used for crafting as a required tool
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for engines that are human-powered
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for engines that are wind-powered
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for CBMs that are sun-powered
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for CBMs that are metabolism-powered
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, used as fuel type for CBMs that are bug powered.
description: seeing this is a bug

//: pseudo item, only used for as a required tool, checked for in player::amount_of

name.str: a smoking device and a source of flame

description: seeing this is a bug
seeing this is a bug
//: Fist is internally represented as 'wielding a none as a weapon'

description: Several documents with all kinds of information, customer data and charts kept together, pretty useless now though.
A white piece of paper, with a fancy-looking logo printed on its upper left corner.  It'd probably be very fascinating reading material.
A bright pink loyalty card, all the points are stamped.  This would definitely prove your fidelity to Foodplace, if it still meant anythingâ€¦
A dead plant.  Good for starting fires or making a pile of leaves to sleep on.
A small bolt of fur from an animal.  Can be made into warm clothing.
A small bolt of garishly colored faux fur.  Can be made into clothing.
A smallish patch of leather, could be used to make tough clothing.
A smallish patch of felt, could be disassembled for wool fiber.
A small bolt of Nomex fire-resistant fabric.
A tube of strong glue.  Used in many crafting recipes.
Glue made from boiling animal bones.  The adhesive isn't strong enough for heavy-duty usages, but it can be used as a varnish or holding together small items.

//: Ammo instead of generic as it sees use in makeshift repair kit.
description: Sticky resin made from pine or birch tar.  Can be used for waterproofing or holding together small items, or for improvised repairs with the right tools.  When dried further it's known as rosin, often used as flux for solder.
A token, representing fertilization of a plant.
A heavy steel chain.  Useful as a weapon, or for crafting.  It has a chance to wrap around your target, allowing for a bonus unarmed attack.
A piece of an insect's exoskeleton.  It is light and very durable.

This is a cluster of membranous bubbles, each about the size of a grape, retrieved from inside a mutant insect.  They float like tiny helium balloons, and are likely full of a lighter-than-air gas helping the bug to fly.
A set of small slightly elongated disks, made of high-grade ceramic.  They remind you of scales.
A lump of exoskeleton that has undergone biosilicification.  It is acid-resistant and remarkably sturdy.
Cotton rags, bundled tightly together for storage.  Activate or disassemble to unpack.
Leather patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
Felt patches, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.
An acrylic cube cast around a small black crystal.  It's tepid to the touch.
An unopened biollante flower, brilliant purple in color.  It may still have its sap-producing organ intact.
An empty canister, which may have once held tear gas or other substances.
A fist-sized eyeball with a cross-shaped pupil.  It seems to be made of stone, but doesn't look like it was carved.
A rock the size of your fist.  It is covered with intricate spirals; it is impossible to tell whether they are carved, naturally formed, or some kind of fossil.
A USB thumb drive.  Useful for holding software.
Some type of advanced data storage device.  Useful for storing very large amounts of information.
Evacuation plans, disaster risk projections, personnel lists and last minute communications from just before the end, all scrubbed from FEMA servers and stored in an external hdd.
A gold candlestick.
A large, relatively sharp blade.  Could be used to make bladed weaponry, or attached to a car.
A large, curved blade.  Could be used to assemble a scythe, or make an improvised polearm.
An 8" circular sawblade.  You could make a saw with it, or throw it.  Wielding it without sturdy gloves is a bad idea.
A hollow metal cylinder which is inserted in a tree crust in order to slowly harvest its sap.  Can be used on a maple tree in between late winter and early spring to harvest maple sap.
A length of thin, relatively stiff, steel wire.  Like the sort you find in wire fences.
A length of stiff wire, covered in sharp barbs.

A mat of woven fine steel wire, useful for dryer lint traps and reusable coffee filter baskets.  You could put these on a window to keep mosquitoes and other bugs out, but chainlink fencing will do these days.
A length of rebar, makes a nice melee weapon, and could be handy in constructing tougher walls and such.
A length of track, made from some planks and rails.
Some concrete, ready to be used in a construction project.
A thin skewer carved from bone.  Can be used to cook food over a fire or as a terrible lockpick.
A torch that has consumed all its fuel; it can be recrafted into another torch.
This is a spent magnesium flare.  It is essentially trash.
A large, heavy-duty spring.  Expands with significant force when compressed.
A motorized pushmower that seems to be broken.  You could take it apart if you had a wrench.
A small tent, just big enough to fit a person comfortably.  This tent is broken and cannot be deployed.
A family sized tent, very bulky but with plenty of space.  This tent is broken and can not be deployed.
A heating element, like the ones used in hotplates or kettles.
A simple thermostat controlled by thermal expansion of a bimetal strip.
A large LCD television, full of delicious electronics.
A pilot light from a gas-burning device, this particular one is a simple piezoelectric igniter.

name: delayed fuze
description: A complex mechanical fuze.  It seems it can be used to detonate stable explosives after a short time by triggering it.

name: impact fuze
description: A complex mechanical fuze.  It seems it can be used to detonate stable explosives upon a solid impact.
A small two slice toaster, not much use as anything but spare parts
A home microwave, has probably seen its share of baked beans.  Good for scrap parts.
A broken laptop, basically a paperweight now.
A broken eyebot.  Much less threatening now that it won't be calling for backup.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken skitterbot.  Much less threatening now that it lies limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken lab defense bot, with its casing broken and fluid drained.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken police bot.  Much less threatening now that it's quiet and still.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken nurse bot.  Its smooth face staring vacantly into empty space.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken grocery bot.  Its smiling face staring vacantly into empty space.  Could be gutted for parts.
The body of a busted grocery bot.  Its tarnished face is still smiling.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken hauler bot, now just a mass of limp mechanical limbs and busted chassis.  Only useful for parts now.
A broken riot control bot.  Much less threatening now that it's out of gas.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken prototype robot, well more broken than before.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken miner bot.  Much less threatening now that it's no longer capable of drilling anything.  Could be gutted for parts.
This is a broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
This is a broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
This is a broken mech exoskeleton suit, it looks beyond repair.
A broken riot dispatch, with its mesh midsection filled with fried manhacks and its motor limp and still.  Could be gutted for parts.

A broken military dispatch.  Though the scratched, disarmed manhacks visible in its belly are disarmed, their destructive potential still inspires a spark of fear, even now.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken manhack.  Much less threatening now that it lies limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken grenade hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken magenta hack.  Just looking at the wreck makes you shiver.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken tear gas hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken EMP hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken flashbang hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken C-4 hack.  Much less threatening now that it lies quiet on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
Some kind of automated medical laser cutting system.  It has suffered some damage and doesn't seem to work any more, but it could be gutted for parts.
A high-power laser source, salvaged from some industrial machinery.  Doesn't do anything on its own, but could probably be useful in electronics crafting.
A central processor unit, useful in advanced electronics crafting.
A stick of memory.  Useful in advanced electronics crafting.
//: A stick of DDR4 SRAM is 133.35 x 31.25 x 4.2mm, or 17.5ml. We round up a touch.

description: A power supply unit.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A circuit designed to amplify the strength of a signal.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A circuit designed to repeat a signal.  Useful for crafting communications equipment.
A module designed to receive many forms of signals.  Useful for crafting communications equipment.
A large backlit screen, used for displaying images.  Useful in some electronics recipes.
A small backlit screen, used for displaying images.  Useful in some electronics recipes.
A high-quality lens, useful for focusing or diffusing light.  Might be useful for starting a fire.
A small high-quality lens, useful for focusing or diffusing light.  Might be useful for crafting.
A pair of small darkened glass, like the one that sunglasses are made of.
Once a valuable bionic implant, it has not held up well under repeated use.  This object has been destroyed by excessive electric current and is now useless.
A state-of-the-art optical storage system.  This small slate of transparent glass holds, inscribed as a miniature pattern, the instructions required to create an item through a nanofabricator.

A state-of-the-art optical storage system, containing the instruction set required for the fabrication of complex silicon photonic circuitry.  The data within was once clearly worth millions, but now, you are not sure if it's anything more than a fancy, high-tech paperweight.
A simple thin aluminum shaft.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A very small electric motor like those used in RC cars.  Useful in lots of electronics recipes.
A printed card that supports and electrically connects electronic components on a non-conductive substrate.
A random collection of resistors, capacitors, and diodes which have been stripped from printed circuits.
A system designed to convert a radio station into an autonomous repeater.
A small fan, used to propel air around a room.
A ceramic armor plate, specifically engineered for use in a bullet resistant vest.
A filled fishbowl, the tag says 'to Ed' and the fish's name, 'Hoss'.  The fish appears to have tiny antlers.
This is a largish piece of cloth, useful in crafting and possibly for staunching bleeding.  It's a bug if you see this.
This is a largish piece of cloth, useful in crafting and possibly for staunching bleeding.
A large rag, drenched in blood.  It could be cleaned with boiling water.
This is a tool designed to clean interior surface of pipes, bottles, and similar objects.  This one is thin enough to be used for cleaning firearm barrels from dirt and fouling.
A small mechanical clock.  Tells the time and has an alarm clock feature.
A small assortment of gears and other clockwork gubbins.
A memory card, used.  Might be worth a look.
This memory card is either unused or has been wiped clean.  You could use it to store your data, though!
This memory card appears to have the firmware encryption set.  Hopefully it contains something worth encrypting.
This memory card appears to be related to 'XEDRA', and is certainly encrypted.  Looks *Interesting*, thoughâ€¦
A small hand mirror.
A heavy iron disc that typically covers a ladder into the sewers.  Lifting it from the manhole is impossible without a crowbar.
A branch from a pine tree, oozing sticky sap and bristling with prickly needles.
A spiny pod from a pine tree.  Dry seeds rattle around inside when you shake it.
A poppy bud.  Contains some substances commonly produced by a mutated poppy flower.
The top of a sunflower, with yellow pedals and some seeds that have yet to be eaten by animals.
White chamomile flowers, used as a herbal remedy since the ancient times.
A lovely flower that grows on the surface of bodies of freshwater.  Traditionally connected with many Eastern cultures.
A handful of yellow-green flowers.  Can be brewed into a tea that prevents asthma attacks.
A fresh piece of clay.  Useful for some crafting recipes.
A fire hardened building block used in masonry construction.
Some mortar, ready to be used in building projects.
A compacted mass of soil and natural fibers, still too wet to build with.  You could load it onto a pallet and leave it to dry to process them in bulk.

use_action.msg: You test the brick, and it seems solid enough to use.
use_action.not_ready_msg: The brick is still too damp to bear weight.

description: A compacted mass of soil and natural fibers, baked dry enough to harden into a brick.
A thick, pasty mud, low in sand content to reduce crumbling once dry.  Used to glue larger, heavier pieces of mud and clay together.
A sheet of tannin-rich bark from a tree, useful for tanning leather.
A sheet of tough, water-resistant bark taken from a birch tree.
A sheet of bark taken from a willow tree.  Used in the production of aspirin.
A sparkling diamond.
A sparkling garnet.
A sparkling amethyst.
A sparkling aquamarine.
A sparkling emerald.
A sparkling alexandrite.
A lustrous pearl.
A sparkling ruby.
A sparkling peridot.
A sparkling sapphire.
A lustrous opal.
A sparkling tourmaline.
A sparkling citrine.
A sparkling blue topaz.
A rolled up animal hide which has been scraped of extraneous hair and flesh and treated to prevent decay.  It could be tanned and transformed into usable leather patches.
A rolled up animal hide which has been scraped of extraneous hair and flesh and treated to prevent decay.  It could be tanned and transformed into usable fur pelts.
A pile of dry grass.  Can be used to craft a straw bed if there is nothing else to sleep on.
Old straw doll.  Represents a woman in a dress.
A pillow to rest your head on when sleeping.
A big, body-sized pillow with a print of an anime character on the front and their scantily clad version on the back.
A fluffy pillow to rest your head on when sleeping.
An old and half rotten teddy bear.  Looks like this one commemorates the grave of the child who once owned it.
A cuddly plush teddy bear.  It is wearing a little red tshirt but no pants.
A bundle holding many 20 dollar bills, pretty useless now though.
This is a medical device that bears the approval of the FDA (Food and Drug Administration).  If used properly, these pouches can keep things sterile indefinitely.
The smoke billowing from this cigar has a sweet, musty odor.
A true gentleman always finishes his cigars.
Smoke swirls from the lit end of this cigarette, filling the air with the thrilling smell of burning chemicals.

What was once a wonderfully addictive tube of dried tobacco leaf is now just a smelly piece of trash.  What a tragedy!
The leftover tobacco in a few of these could probably be used to roll another cigarette.  If you're willing to go that farâ€¦
The smell of skunk permeates the air as a thin trail of smoke floats off of this joint.

The smoked-down butt of a joint, a reminder of some good times.  Pretty much trash now.  Bummer, man.
A few of these could probably be used to roll another joint.

A psychoactive plant indigenous to Central Asia and the Indian subcontinent traditionally cultivated for its fiber, oil, for medicinal purposes, and for use as a recreational drug.  It requires further processing to be useful.
Various parts of tobacco plant, full of nicotine.  They need to be dried to become smokable.
A yellow plastic card used to store money.  These became popular once the government officially moved to all electronic money.  It holds up to 2 million dollars.
This small transparent card was attached to the prototype robot's CPU.  It might contain the data the intercom spoke of.
This card gives you a little discount on the purchase of gasoline.
This card gives you a good discount on the purchase of gasoline.
This card gives you a splendid discount on the purchase of gasoline.
This ID card once belonged to a scientist.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
This ID card once belonged to a military officer.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
This ID card once belonged to a high level technician.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
A moderately sized sheet of neoprene.  Can be used to craft light and stretchable clothing.
A laser cannon stripped from the barrel of a TX-5LR Cerberus laser turret.  Unusable as a weapon on its own without the necessary parts.
A rapid-fire weapon system stripped from a wrecked combat exoskeleton.  No longer usable as a weapon in its current condition.
A long-range weapon system stripped from a wrecked recon exoskeleton.  No longer usable as a weapon in its current condition.
A rather outdated light bulb used in all sorts of light equipment.
A twisted shard of jagged metal.
A nice looking clay pot used for planting.
A cheap plastic pot used for planting.
This 3L jar contains a human brain preserved in a formaldehyde solution.
A set of long, snakelike tubes for evaporating refrigerant.
A compressor and a fan work together to cool down the refrigerant.
A small tank containing some sort of refrigerant often used in devices such as freezers.  Hermetically sealed to prevent evaporation - cannot be opened without prior connection to compatible valve.
An armor plating made of a very thick steel, specifically engineered for use in a bullet resistant vest.
A steel armor plate, specifically engineered for use in a bullet resistant vest.
A small lock, with a set of keys still inserted.
This is an in progress craft.
A bumper mounted rig for attaching and storing a spare tire on the back of a vehicle.  Combine it with a wheel to get a mountable piece.
A set of components useful for constructing a full-featured welding station, complete with soldering capability.
An amplifier head.  Typically paired with a speaker cabinet for amplifying musical instruments.  Basically only good for spare parts now.
A broken turret.  Much less threatening now that it's laid limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken riot control turret.  Much less threatening now that it's laid limp on solid ground.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken secubot, with its casing broken and fluid drained.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken TALON UGV, with its casing broken and fluid drained.  Could be gutted for parts.
A reinforced brick designed to withstand intense heat.  It could also be used as an impromptu anvil for light metalworking.
A small box filled with tools and items to help you survive in case of an emergency.  Disassemble to get its content.

The ultimate survival kit purchased either by the wealthy or the dedicated urban survivalist.  It contains tools and items to help you survive in case of an emergency.  Disassemble to get its contents.
A six-sided plastic dice.
A heavy cube-shaped block of salt for livestock.  Don't lick it, it's gross.
A pillow to rest your head on when sleeping.  This one is made entirely of fluffy wool!
This is a plate of reinforced Kevlar.  It could be used to repair items made of Kevlar.
A bony and scaled protrusion harvested from a large reptile.  Such things were used to make handbags before the Cataclysm, but the material is sturdy and protective.
A bone harvested from a large animal such as an elephant, or from certain types of zombies.  It is extremely dense and durable for its size, and largely inedible.
Teeth harvested from a carnivore such as a shark, or from certain types of mutant animals.  They are extremely dense and durable for their size, and can very easily cause jagged wounds.
A large, enclosed wooden box with multiple sliding frames in it.  With something to attract bees, it can be used to grow a hive.
A slightly large shark plushie, perfect for cuddles.
